page.title: 12BURTON PIDSEA RIDING SCHOOL
page.content: Bramhill Riding School is owned and run by Julie Sargeant. She has 14 ponies and two horses at present at the stables; the oldest is 26 years old. Some of the ponies belong to the school itself for use by people requiring riding lessons. Others are owned by local people but are stabled and exercised at the riding school. Pupils of the riding school learn everything about the ponies, not just how to ride. They have to groom and tack up the ponies and learn how to keep the tack clean too. When we visited the stables Julie showed us horses being groomed and where all the equipment was kept. She also told us how important it is to feed the horses properly. Julie was busy that day getting everything ready for the Carnival.
